Name: BrainBox: Peppa Pig
Description:
â€‹This brilliant BrainBox features Peppa Pig, her little brother George and the rest of her family and friends in a whole variety of situations, from playing in the rain to dressing up, riding in a hot air balloon to washing the car, and is great family fun.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.
Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun.

Name: Brainbox: Bogyó és Babóca
Description:
Brainbox: Bogyó és Babóca is a version developed for the Hungarian market.

What do Bogyó and Babóca do on the cards? The BrainBox - Berry and Babóca board game develops memory talent with the kids' favorite characters, Berry, Babóca and the rest of the forest. The drawn card must be memorized for 10 seconds and then answered with questions such as: what is in the hands of the children, what color does the white lock paint? The correct answer to the questions is the one who gives the most good answers.

Name: Droplets
Description:
Droplets is an abstract, strategic placement, area control, chain reaction game, in which you play droplets of water onto the board. As droplets accumulate in a space, they can trigger a splash, causing all the droplets within to move outwards. These can, in turn, cause other splashes to be triggered – though not always under your control, and not always for your benefit.
Your goal is to splash your droplets onto the fountains around the board, while sending your opponents’ down the drain.

—description from the designer

Name: Oregano: The Veggie Card Game
Description:
Oregano: The Veggie Card Game is a family-friendly game that teaches you about your fruits and veggies!

Gameplay is similar to Crazy Eights, but instead of matching the face-up card with a card from your hand by Suit or Number, you match by Plant Family or Plant Part. For example, a Broccoli Card could be matched by any other Brassicacea (such as Turnip), OR by any other plant of which we can eat or use the Flower (such as Chamomile).

There are Skips in the form of Pests to terrorize your neighbours’ vegetables and Wilds in the form of Companion Plants - which can additionally be used to protect yourself from Pests!

Players will learn useful and practical knowledge about the foods we eat and how to grow them successfully, and the game has been child-playtested for truly countless hours in an agricultural education program.

—description from the designer

Name: Rêve de trésor
Description:
This game is about you been the first to find the pirate treasure.
You need to collect the 3 objects: the map, a key and the compass.
Then you need to go to one of the three island to return the treasure card and find the treasure (the 2 others been empty and with the pirate) before the pirate reach the top of the dedicated scale.

Each turn, the player have to roll a dice, and move accordingly on the board.
Depending on where you finish your move, you may collect:

     one of the needed object
     Relaunch the dice
     Move the main pirate

Name: Hybrords
Description:
Hybrords is a simple, card-based party-style game of portmanteau, in which players creatively combine words to create new words, called hybrords (hybrid words). Players then invent funny or clever definitions for their hybrord, and "sell" it to the judge as creatively as possible. The judge selects not only the round winner, but also the rules to be used for that round. Add to other players' hybrords/definitions, and potentially earn assists!

The fun even continues after the game is over, since players will be using these hybrords in conversation for the rest of the night, and even beyond! With an official Hybrords dictionary, fans can even share their creativity with the rest of the Hybrords community!

With so much riding on players' own creativity, it's the game that's only as fun as you are! But with all of the laughs to be had, there really are no losers in Hybrords!

—description from the publisher

Name: Pocket-Escape: Das Phantom im Park
Description:
Always and everywhere ready for use: Pocket-Escape: Das Phantom im Park features characters of the detective agency Dyscover from the ESCAPE Dysturbia series!

Private investigator Angus Montgomery becomes the target of the underworld organization Syndicate: An anonymous caller threatens to pass on piquant details from his former life as a policeman to the press. Montgomery suspects an ex-colleague behind the unknown who has become a syndicate, but there is no evidence! Together with Ada Svoboda, computer specialist and member of the detective agency Dyscover, he sets out to expose the culprit.

28 pages of puzzles and difficult decisions await you. Pocket Escape: Das Phantom im Park fits in every pocket — the ideal case for your home or travel bag!

Name: Brainbox: Transport
Description:
However you like to get around, this BrainBox is for you. From a camel to a canoe, a glider to a go-kart, a milk float to a monster truck, this brilliant BrainBox travels by land, air and sea for fantastic family fun. All aboard!

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Name: Brainbox: First Letters
Description: BrainBox First Letters is designed to give pre-school children a head start. Each sturdy double- sided card shows three images with their initial letters on one side and just the images on the other, with the question, “What letter?”. The object of the game is to look at and talk about a card, then turn it over and try to remember the initial letter of each image. If the letters are named correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

Name: BrainBox Board Game
Description:
Take BrainBox to a whole new level with the BrainBox Board Game!

Lift the lid off the box to make the playing board magically appear, then move around the board collecting cards from each of eight subject categories, including Food and Drink, People and Places and Entertainment.

Special squares allow you to pick your own subject category, battle against another player or gamble the cards you hold already in order to win the game.

Name: Lélekpillangó
Description:
What better adventure than getting to know ourselves and our fellow players? What makes the other happy, what makes him happy?
During the Spirit Butterfly board game, players try to figure out which of their players to choose from. The Soul Butterfly will test how deeply we know others and ourselves. With its unique, special beauty cards and situational situations, it offers many gaming surprises to newcomers to the world of board games.

There are two ways to play the game. Basic game and situational game version.
 For the base game, the board must be placed on the A side. Each player chooses one color and receives the corresponding tip puck and puppet. The starting player receives a gray marker card and one of each player's suit. The butterfly card 60 and the gift card 21 must be shuffled and placed face down on the board. This will be the draw deck.
 The dealer draws one less card than the number of players and puts it face up. Place at least one face down card on each card. You can also use gray for a card you think is not close to any player. The players then try to guess which card the dealer intended for them by using the tip disc. Depending on how confident you are with one or two point sides. Then the markers turn and the evaluation follows. For correct tips, the player's dummy moves on the scoring bar to score points.
 In the situation version, if the dealer is on a situation field, you will have to draw two situation cards and read one of them. You will need to place your marker cards accordingly. The dealer on the smiley field acts according to the basic game. While a player on the doubling field will score all points, but in the case of a dealer, the player can decide whether to play the turn normally or draw from the situation cards.
 The winner of the game is the one whose puppy crosses the finish line first or moves to that field.

Name: Rolling Stone
Description:
Rolling Stone is a rock & roll music game for anyone who has ever heard a song. You don't have to be a music buff to win this game; you just need to know the names of some very famous bands and have heard a famous song or two.

To start, a player from each team competes in the Music Buzzer Battle. The winner of this round takes an advantage into Round 2: Triple Charades Jeopardy. Here, players try to get their team to guess the artist by describing them in one of three ways: quoting lyrics, humming or using one word. The first team to collect a disc from all eight genres wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fartzilla
Description:
Fartzilla is a push your luck dice rolling card game.  Players play as kaiju-esqe "bad guys" aiming to destroy as many buildings as possible.

Players guide their individual character or team of characters consisting of: Fartzilla, Bad Phone, Captain Toenail, Chicken Powerup, Lazer Zombie, and Professor Toiler Paper.  Teams can be uneven to make game play more challenging for one or more players.

On each player's turn, she chooses the number of building cards to be attacked.  Three damage dice and one super power die is rolled.  If the player's roll contains a higher number than stated on the buildings chooses, the player has successfully destroyed the buildings and retains the cards for victory points.  Alternatively, each character has an icon the super power die.  Should the player roll the super power corresponding to a character on her team, the player will destroy chosen buildings, regardless of damage die result.

Superheros are hidden in building deck and can only be defeated with a super power.  If not defeated they return back to the deck.

End of game occurs once building deck is exhausted.  Winner is determined by total number of building stories destroyed (corresponding number on building card).

—description from the publisher

Name: Bumbling Bees
Description:
A fine and sunny day, and the fields are in bloom! The bumblebees are hungry, if a bit short-sighted, and need your help to visit as many flowers as possible. With just a single sheet and a pen, can you guide them through the fields?

Bumbling Bees is a fold-and-write game for a single player, requiring nothing more than a printed sheet of paper, a pair of scissors, and a pen. The current time creates a unique setup condition so no two games are the same. Throughout the game, you will begin to fold your game sheet over on itself, concealing portions of the playing field and creating new opportunities. For fans of roll-and-write games, this offers a similar one-page puzzle experience without the dice.

Name: Revenants
Description:
It's the mid 1980ies and a mutated rabies virus wiped out almost every single life on earth. Those, who have been infected with the Zion virus transformed into soulless, bloodthirsty creatures hunting for every living.

Revenants is a tabletop RPG in an post-apocalyptic 80ies scenario with a completely randomized playing field, randomized encounters and randomized loot to grant maximum playing variety over uncountable gaming sessions. 
The players slip into the role of those ones, who are resistant against the virus and therefore being able to scavenge contaminated areas for valuable resources and items to support other survivor guilds.

Revenants comes with over 150 desk tiles, with different landscapes like forests, fields, meadows, urban areas, many different buildings, scenes and places - each individually designed, over 60 figurines of Revenant-creatures and eerie mutations, over 300 item cards bearing melee- and ranged weapons, armor, traps, survival-, medical- and household items and many more to make each experience completely unique.

Up to 5 players can choose out of several characters, each one with uniquely abilities and skill trees and keep, train, level up and equip them with everything, they find on their expeditions. As the survivors improve with every game, so do their encounters. Less loot and harder enemies make 'Revenants' a constant challenge for everyone. Whether open range or close combat house-to-house melee fighting: Team play and tactics is important to survive the horde.

Name: Revenge of the Mortals
Description:
It is a dark time for the Mortals. Creatures have driven them from their cabins in Camp Murkwood and pursued them all the way to the Forbidden Island.

Evading the dreaded onslaught, a group of fighters led by no one has begun to resist these creature threats with weapons stolen from the mad scientist armory.

These scientists, obsessed with their next great creation, have dispatched creatures to continue the hunt. But this time, the Mortals plan to fight back...

Revenge of the Mortals is a stand alone game in the Campy-verse where players will take on the roles of different Mortals facing 8 rounds of Creature attacks. Armed with unique weapons, players will need to form squads to combat these creatures, and lucky for you, your party of friends are here to help. But in the end, there can be only one hero of the story.

Your goal, in Revenge, is to score the most valuable Relics and Treasures by defeating Creatures. Revenge of the Mortals is played over the course of eight rounds. Every round a new Creature threat is drawn and each player will play a Weapon card from their hand in an attempt to survive the threat and possibly score some sweet Loot. Players can work together as a squad to overcome these threats or turn on each other in order to score more points. Players will negotiate, and then play a card from their hand face-down in front of them. Once everyone has chosen or The Sands of Time has run out (in which case a card must be selected randomly), each player reveals their chosen card simultaneously. Players will either survive the threat or lose Health. Can you survive the night?

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Snakes Zombie Apocalypse
Description: An action RPG set in a world destroyed by the Zombie Apocalypse. With preset scenarios, create a character and upgradable game layouts. Snakes Zombie Apocalypse allows rich replay and customization to go along with leveling and growing as a character.

Name: The Girl and the Robot: The Card Game
Description:
Take on the role of the girl and the robot as you battle the evil queen in this strategic card game inspired by concepts from Russian roulette and classic shedding card games.

Plan strategies with your ally, deceive your opponents and play cards at key moments to avoid death by the demon.

Basic Gameplay:

     Each player takes turns one after the other.
     Draw a card at the end of your turn, if it’s a Demon, you’re dead.
     When you play in teams, if both you and your ally die, you lose the game.
     To prevent this from happening, use your character’s Abilities, play Action and Weapon cards during your turn.


—description from the publisher

Name: Ars Universalis: Verkami Extra Characters Blister Pack
Description: A blister pack with three extra characters for the game: Bernini, Tesla and Ockham. Each with its own illustration.

Name: Pronti... A Voi!
Description:
Pronti… A voi!(Pret... Allez!) is a game for two people lasting about 30 minutes. The players identify themselves with the fencers engaged in an "assault" on the platform. The rules explain the specific rules of the game, but will also explain and deepen the rules and technique of the Fencing and its correct terminology, as used by teachers to teach and communicate with their athletes. Furthermore, a separate booklet is dedicated to a TECHNICAL DEEPENING that focuses on the meaning and explanation of each technique represented by the cards.

The rules manual is divided into 3 different game modes:

Tutorial - it allows you to become familiar with the game mechanisms and to know the cards, moreover some basic fencing principles are introduced without considering the more complex actions. A game for everyone, from the smallest to the oldest, with a few simple basic rules and a classic approach to card games that introduces the world of fencing without difficulty.

Basic Game - introduces the essential aspects of fencing and allows you to start creating the first game strategies depending on the cards available. Suitable for regular players and even for newcomers to fencing.

Advanced Game - simulates the Sword Fencing "at the top"; it is suitable for experienced players and those "regular" athletes who want to practice their favorite sport even on a gaming table.

Pronti… A voi! è un gioco per due persone della durata di 30 minuti circa. I giocatori si immedesimano negli schermidori impegnati in un “assalto” sulla pedana. Nel regolamento vengono spiegate le regole specifiche del gioco, ma verranno anche spiegate e approfondite le regole e la tecnica della Scherma e la sua corretta terminologia, come viene usata dai maestri per insegnare e comunicare con i propri atleti. Inoltre, un libretto a parte è dedicato ad un APPROFONDIMENTO TECNICO che si sofferma sul significato e la spiegazione di ogni tecnica rappresentata dalle carte.

Il manuale delle regole è diviso in 3 modalità di gioco diverse:

Tutorial – permette di acquisire dimestichezza con i meccanismi di gioco e di conoscere le carte, inoltre vengono introdotti alcuni principi di base della scherma senza considerare le azioni più complesse. Un gioco per tutti, dai più piccoli ai più grandi, con poche semplici regole di base ed un approccio classico ai giochi di carte che introduce al mondo schermistico senza difficoltà.

Gioco Base – introduce gli aspetti essenziali della scherma e permette di cominciare a creare le prime strategie di gioco in funzione delle carte a disposizione. Adatto ai giocatori abituali e anche ai neofiti della scherma.

Gioco Avanzato – simula “al top” la Scherma di Spada; è adatto a giocatori esperti e a quegli atleti “abituali” che vogliono praticare il loro sport preferito anche su un tavolo da gioco.

Name: Shadow Master
Description:
To master the Guilds, you must first master the shadows. You ply your trade lurking in the depths of the city, while committing unspeakable skulduggery and, all the while, developing your dark arts and spell craft. Direct confrontation is not your preference; however, there will be times you must fight to advance through the challenges, quests and battles that lay ahead. All you need to do is advance 11 Levels, through 11 increasing Guilds, while engaging in 22 different Quests and acquiring up to 15 different Skills and Spells. Sound like a lot to track? Nonsense! It is all contained on ONE page.  You roll. You write.  Hopefully, you advance . . . or at least live to fight another day . . . which for us humble few, is all we ask.  This takes the One Page In A Life Series (OPIAL Series) further into the Fantasy Realm.

Components:
1 Character Page (actually, this is entire game . . . except for the dice . . . oh, and a pen or pencil)
4 Red Dice (Combat Dice)
4 Blue Dice (Magic Dice)
4 Green Dice (Nature Dice)

Name: Vanguard of War: Heroes Vs Zombies
Description:
Heroes vs Zombies is a 1-6 player variant ruleset for the Vanguard of War (VoW) tower defense miniatures game. A brave group of heroes must take up arms yet again to face a new threat, as armies of the living dead march toward Fateera. Players will place turrets, explore the terrain to find deadly weapons, and use an array of skills and abilities to hold the line against the Zombie Queen, Morrigan, and prevent her undead legion from reaching the city.

—description from the designer

Name: Harter Tobak Roast: Die Mobbing Edition
Description:
Harter Tobak is a German card game by Simon & Jan where you have to fill in the blanks and build card combinations.
The standard version of it launched in 2014,  the Mobbing Edition. In the end of 2018 the Mobbing Edition has been released.

The 2014 version was very comparable to cards against humanity individualized by a whole bunch of special cards that changed the game mechanisms mid-game.

The so called Mobbing Edition from 2018 brought in a very unique focus by specializing on bullying the people playing this game. In every round there is one bully and one bullying victim. The card combinations that need to be created have the goal to hit the chosen bullying victim.

—description from the publisher

Name: Clank! Legacy: Acquisitions Incorporated – Fabulous Display
Description:
This card was offered as a promo item at the Renegade Game Studios booth at Gencon 2019 and Spiel 2019.

Text says:
You may discard a card to get 2 gold. If you discarded a Tome (of any kind), get 5 instead.

Name: Korowai: A Tribal Survival Game
Description:
The Korowai are a real ancient tribe that has lived in West Papua for centuries. Isolated from modern world, they live their life using primitive tools and method. Hunting wild boars, fishing and eat sago as their main food source. They build their house at the top of the trees to avoid wild beasts in the night. Korowai also believe in spirits and God, so they have festival, myths, and folktales that honor around their Gods.

Korowai: A Tribal Survival Game is a game about survival and adventure of Korowai tribesman. Player will become a tribesman that will hunt, farm, and logging for the live of their tribe. While they must avoid any danger, wild beast, hazards, or any catastrophic event they encounter.

Korowai is a push your luck game in its essence. While adventuring, players will open a card in adventure deck. Then, simultaneously player must decide to play their top card deck, their hand, or pass. There is some good cards and bad cards in their deck depending on the adventure card they encounter in that round. After 9 to 12 adventure cards, player will be back to their village. In the village player must eat their hunts, build their house, gain a new skill, and participate in the festival.

Player who have the most Experience Points, will become the next chieftain of the village and wins the game.

Name: Hadara: Nobles & Inventions
Description: Hadara: Nobles & Inventions is the first mini expansion for Hadara. This expansion adds 48 new cards to the pool.

Name: Hadara: Marketplaces & Monuments
Description:
The Hadara: Marketplaces & Monuments mini-expansion brings two new elements to the game: monuments and marketplaces. Marketplaces allow players to profit from extra food. Monuments will award players many points if they expand military and culture equally.

Monuments require 24 points in each of culture and military. If you reuse the monument, you get 12 coins and 16 victory points. If you pay 4 coins to build it, you'll get even more points and additional movement on a track or end game points.

The market tiles have 2 sides - a small side (6 yellow, 2 extra green) and a large side (18 yellow, 6 extra green). After you do your normal income, if you've met these requirements, add (or flip) the market tile to your marketplace. If a market tile is present, gain bonus coins (1 for the small, 2 for large) which may be added to your coin pool or placed below the market. Coins in the market will bump the corresponding track or contribute to end game points. Your marketplace is also worth 5 (small) or 15 (large) points at the end of the game.

Name: Waroong Wars (Second Edition): Ghosty Comics Promo cards
Description:
This promo consists of 4 cards :

- 2 Jaret
  Customer card
  If you don't "cook" any menu this turn, instead of taking "Go Boy!", "cook" the lowest point menu card.

- 2 Nasi Kecap
  Menu card
  0 Point
  Need 1 rice ingredient card to "cook". Kerupuk and/or sambal ingredient card can be added to add 2/4 point bonus.

During game setup the cards are shuffled in their respective piles.

Name: Bagolytanoda
Description:
Bagolytanoda is an educational board game for children between 8 and 10. It is supporting the studies of elementary school second, third and fourth classes, for Hungarian language and nature subjects. The game not only asks for existing knowledge but helps with teaching the basic material personalized for each single class. The game uses tile placement mechanism, and so the environment is variable while owls are discovering the surroundings. Questions are card-based, right answers worth gems, which may be spent on marketplaces, buying antique codexes.

—user summary

A Bagolytanoda egy oktató kvízjáték, ami az alsó tagozatos anyanyelvi és környezetismereti tananyagra épülve a legalapvetÅ‘bb tudnivalókat nem csupán kikérdezi, játékosan meg is tanítja.

A kérdéseket általános iskolai tanítók segítségével állítottuk össze, külön a második, a harmadik, és a negyedik osztályos tananyagot támogatva, így a játékosok az évfolyamuknak megfelelÅ‘en választhatnak a paklik közül. Helytállását szakmai szempontból a Tanítók Egyesületének ajánlása igazolja. A játék izgalmas felfedezÅ‘út is egyben, a gyerekek a játéktér önálló építésének köszönhetÅ‘en aktívan gyakorolják a számolást, az elÅ‘relátó tervezést és az erÅ‘forrásaikkal való gazdálkodást.

A játék során a gyerekek bagolyfiókák bÅ‘rébe bújnak, akik tanulmányi kirándulásra indulnak. A még ismeretlen terepet körrÅ‘l körre maguk építik, és drágaköveket gyÅ±jtenek, mindeközben feleletválasztós kérdésekre válaszolnak. Ha áldoznak rá plusz lépést, a könyvtárban akár meg is nézhetik, mi a soron következÅ‘ kérdés, így magabiztosan indulhatnak tovább gyÅ±jtögetni. Ha a játékosok elegendÅ‘ kincset gyÅ±jtöttek, felkereshetik a piacon kereskedÅ‘ bölcs baglyokat, akiktÅ‘l kódexeket vásárolhatnak. Az nyer, aki a legtöbb kódexet gyÅ±jti össze a játék során.

—description from the publisher

Name: Promise Tested
Description:
Before the Great Cataclysm the realms of Promise are being attacked. Ancient decisions and strange forces have come against all the realms. You must overcome these tests to save all of Promise. Explore the realmscape in search for Artifacts, Knowledge, Allies, and Resources. Gather what you find to help you in your quest, or deliver them to your realm to bring prosperity. Use whatever you have to save the realms of Promise Tested.

Promise Tested is a an expansion for Promise Reborn that takes the normal game and turns it into a solo or cooperative game. If you can Bury 10 Tests before there are 6 Tests in the Test pile, all the players win. Otherwise, the realms of Promise fall and all the players lose.

—description from the publisher

Name: Promise At War
Description:
Before the Great Cataclysm the realms of Promise were at war with one another. During this war, you were selected to explore the realmscape in search of Artifacts, Knowledge, Allies, and Resources to help your realm achieve victory. Gather things to help your war efforts, deliver things to your realm to reinforce it, and attack you enemies during Promise At War.

Promise At War is an expansion for Promise Reborn that takes the classic deck-building game and turns it into a player vs player battle royale where the last Realm standing wins. Play up to 4 players at the table and see who wins the wars of Promise's brutal past.

—description from the publisher

A copy of Promise Reborn is required to play this expansion.

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Gen Con 2019 Genevieve Promo Pack
Description:
For this year's Gen Con, SlugFest Games got to partner with the convention to produce this 3-card promo pack featuring the show mascot, Genevieve! In these cards, Genevieve the red dragon is visiting The Red Dragon Inn, ready to share her Morsel of Wisdom, a Dragon's Flight of wines, and The Best Four Beers in Greyport!

—description from the publisher

The print run was limited to 2000 copies.

Name: Socianimals
Description:
Socianimals is a card game about animals and families. The main goal of the game is to collect as many animals of the same family as you can. The more animals in the same family you collect the more points you score.
Every player starts with 5 cards in its hand. Every turn a player takes a card from a covered common deck (thus reaching 6 cards in hand) and then must play a card.

Once a card (an animal) is on the table another player can take it only if he has an animal of the same family. Once a player take a couple of animals from the same family those 2 cards must be put covered near the player who took them and they are part of his/her deck points.

Special cards can be played to steal/block/protect animals family(a couple or more couple of the same family).

—description from the designer

Name: Clank! Legacy: Acquisitions Incorporated – Shadow Chancellor
Description:
A promo card for Clank! Legacy, given with pre-orders of the C-Team pack.

Cost: 7 
3 Victory Points
3 Gold
Draw 3 cards
Each other player gets one gold and draws one card.

Name: Clank! Legacy: Acquisitions Incorporated – Mister Whiskers
Description:
The Legacy version of Mister Whiskers offer with pre-order of Clank Legacy or in Conventions.

Cost 1
1Vp
The dragon attacks
or
-2 Clank

Name: Rune Stones: Queenie 1 – New Rune Stones
Description: Adds two new Rune Stones types, "Discard Lowest" and "Gem for Points."

Name: Dany: Promo cards
Description:
Two new cards to be inserted in the draw pile.
This promo also propose a variant rule for the final vote: if a tie exists, the Personalities who are tied keep their card face down, then a new vote occurs.
French edition of the promo found in Plato Magazine 120

Name: TOKYO CAPSULE HOTEL
Description:
With real-time open bartering, land subdivision, a hand drawn map, many custom pieces, and more, TOKYO CAPSULE HOTEL throws a crazy mix into heavy economic games.

Join other investors in Neo-Tokyo as you build attractions, buy and sell franchises, purchase land, and talk your way into profitable situations.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ostroleka 16 lutego 1807
Description:
OstroÅ‚Ä™ka 16 lutego 1807 covers the battle of OstroÅ‚Ä™ka, fought on Feb. 16, 1807 between the French 5th Corps commanded by Gen. Jean-Anne-Marie Savary and the Russian Corps commanded by Gen. Ivan N. Essen. The main goal of the French Corps was to secure the supply line of Napoleon’s main army fighting with Gen. Bennigsen. Just after the bloody battle of Preussisch Eylau (Feb. 7-8, 1807) both sides started to look for possibilities of taking advantage over the enemy and draw away some opposite forces from the main theater before the next expected battle. After set of back and forth operations in the north Mazovia, Russians decided to launch an offensive against units of the Frech 5th Corps situated near OstroÅ‚Ä™ka. Russian commander, Gen. Essen, strengthened by the 6th Division of Gen. Sedmioradski, prepared a plan of attack. He decided to divide his forces into two wings. One of them (6th Division and a part of 9th Division), commanded by Gen. Wolkonski, had to attack the town OstroÅ‚Ä™ka from the north, approaching along the west bank of Narew river. The other wing (10th Division and a part of 9th Division), commanded by Gen. Essen, approaching along the east bank of Narew river, had to attack the town OstroÅ‚Ä™ka from the east. Russians had significant numerical advantage but their problem was that both operational groups were completely separated by the impassable river with marshy banks and in effect could not suport each other.

Before the battle started, Russians had made feign attacks near Myszyniec along the line of communication of the main French army, north-west of OstroÅ‚Ä™ka, fooling the French command. Gen. Savary decided to send there whole 1st Infantry Division of Gen. Suchet. Before the battle started, two events had taken place that had great impact on the course of it. The first one caused that Russians completely lost surprise effect. French caught the Russian messanger with letter from Essen to Bennigsen, from which they got to know the plan of the offensive. However we do not know how many details of it. The second event was also disadvantageous for the Russian Corps command. Gen. Bennigsen, who was the commander-in-chief of all Russian forces operating against Napoleon, recalled 6th Division of Gen. Sedmioradski to the main Russian army, to the north. Gen. Wolkonski, supported by Gen. Essen, tried to convince Gen. Sedmioradski to postpone execution of this order and take part in the planned ofensive against French 5th Corps, but Sedmioradski decided to obey strictly order from the upper commander and had marched to the north just befeore the offensive started. The effect was that Wolkonski’s group which had to advance along the west bank of Narew river was reduced to 1/3 of its units.

The battle of OstroÅ‚Ä™ka fought in 1807 is a classical example of the maneuver from a central position. Knowing more or less enemy’s plans, early morning of Feb. 16, 1807, near 4 AM Gen. Savary also decided to divide his forces into two groups. He found the Russian wing approaching along the west bank of the Narew river as more dangerous because it could had cut him off from his line of communication. That is why he decided to march with the majority of his forces to the north, defeat it as the first and then revert back to the OstroÅ‚Ä™ka to fight with the rest of the Russians. In OstroÅ‚Ä™ka Savary left only 8 battalions with some artillery and cavalry. They had to defend and keep the town until he had defeated the enemy approaching from the north. Battle fought by Savary with Wolkonski’s group near StanisÅ‚awów was quick. Russian General, seeing enemy strongly outnumbering his group, after short combat started retreat. It was 10 AM when being near StanisÅ‚awów Savary heard the sound of cannonade coming from OstroÅ‚Ä™ka. At that moment he realised the Russian group he defeated was the smaller one and the main Russian forces were at OstroÅ‚Ä™ka attacking small French contingent he had left there in the morning to defend the town and area around it. Leaving some units to pursuit Wolkonski’s group Savary ordered force march to OstroÅ‚Ä™ka. It was noon when the first units of his group appeared near the town where they met coming back from the north west 1st Infantry Division of Gen. Suchet. How defenders of the town were able to keep control of it to that time is another story. Some historical sources mention that although outnumbered, they even attacked Russians in the first part of the battle, confusing them and disturbing the decisive attack. Also some parts of Essen’s group were delayed. Finally, near noon, when the defenders were about to lose, suprisingly Russian attacks on the town stopped. Russian command decided to withdraw to the positions to the east of OstroÅ‚Ä™ka, stay there until the end ot the day and make retreat during night. When Savary’s group and the 1st Infantry Division crossed the Narew river and formed the battle line, the last part of the battle commenced. There were no more than 2 hours to the dusk but it was enough for the French to break Essen’s group, however in effect of darkness, early coming during winter, the victory was not so overwhelming as it had been if the French had had more time. It is estimated that Russian lost 2500-3000 casualties, while French 1500-2000 ones.

The game is an expansion for OstroÅ‚Ä™ka 26 maja 1831. It means that OstroÅ‚Ä™ka 16 lutego 1807 uses system rules (also charts & tables), markers and the board which are in OstroÅ‚Ä™ka 26 maja 1831. There are special rules for this historical period and battle (2 pages only). There are three scenarios in the game: 
- The Defense of OstroÅ‚Ä™ka, 
- Operational,
- The Battle on the East Bank of the Narew River. 
The first scenario covers the initial part of the battle. Its feature is a chit-pull system, used to simulate activity of the French units at the beginning of the combat and their better command system. The second scenario, the largest one, allows to play the whole battle. Its aim is also to show the operational background around the battlefield. It tries to join two levels of warfare: tactical and operational. In fact it is a kind of scenario generator: each player can choose among few options how to divide his forces among two groups. This decision has a great impact on the course of the game. Another important decision up to the Russian player is possible bringing to the battle Russian 6th Division of Gen. Sedmioradski, what gives him more forces but changes victory conditions to more demanding for the Russians. There is a plenty of additional options for this scenario. The third scenario depicts the last part of the battle, great frontal struggle on the east bank of the Narew river with most of the units participating in it. The playing time varies depending on the scenario, style of play and many other factors. The third scenario is the shortest while the second scenario as a whole is definitely the longest one. However in case of lack time, basing on the second scenario you can create little battles which can be played in 2-3 hours.

Components (all packed in ziplock):
- 324 die-cut counters (9 small counter sheets)
- One rulebook and scenariobook (both in one book)
- Two sheets with unit rosters (for French and Russians)
- One sheet with turn tracks
- Four bags for counters

Name: Soviet Fallout: The Nagorno-Karabakh War – 1992-1994
Description:
The Nagorno-Karabakh War: Soviet Fallout: 1992-1994 is a simulation of the war between Azerbaijan and the breakaway province (Oblast) of Nagorno-Karabakh, inhabited by a majority of Armenians. After the first ethnic clashes between Armenians and Azeri, during the death throes of the Soviet Union, Nagorno-Karabakh declared independence from Azerbaijan. The Azeri launched an ethnic cleansing campaign. Faced with annihilation, the Armenians resisted and fought back, conquering most of Nagorno-Karabakh and parts of eastern Azerbaijan, a situation which has lasted until today (2019).

The Nagorno-Karabakh War is a two player game: the Armenian (AR) player and the Azeri (AZ) player. The AR player must fight a numerically superior foe but he has the advantage of interior lines and a unified command, whereas the AZ player has a greater supply of former Red Army weapons and ammunition but has to fight not only the Armenians but also political infighting and low morale. In this game, the enemy population it is not the victim of collateral damage: the enemy population is the target, so conquering towns and villages and practicing ethnical cleansing is a key aspect of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: La Grande Évasion
Description:
In this prison, it isn't very complicated: the prisoners try to escape, and the guards try to stop them. Whether you find yourself playing the role of a prisoner or a guard, do the best you can.

The game is played in several round, continuing until one player (or more) achieves a score of 4 points.

Each round will be dealt a secret roles, and a hand of card. You play those card to help, or not in an escape routes. Cards have to be alternately placed face up / face down with the first card played on the route determining the order.

At the end of a round, each player will secretly select one route.
Then we reveal each card of each route, if the total number exceed the route demand and no gard is here, then the prisoners on this route escape and score one point each.
If any gard or if the total is lower, no escape, no point.
If no prisoner at all escapes, then each gard score 1 point.
New round...

Name: Pocket Bible Pictures
Description:
Similar to the popular game Pocket Pictures, this version has you sketch a word chosen from one of five biblical categories (miracles & events, objects, people, places, phrases & parables) and others guess the word from your simple sketches.

—user summary

Name: Landskapsspelet
Description:
This is one of several themed Go Fish/Quartet variants published by K. Hjelm Förlag around the 2000s. The subject is the 25 Swedish provinces, each set of four cards consisting of: one showing the province on a map of Sweden, also listing significant towns, lakes and rivers; one showing the coat of arms; one showing the province animal; and one showing the province plant. A special bonus card shows the coat of arms of Stockholm.

Each player gets an initial hand of seven cards. Gameplay proceeds as normal for Go Fish, with players demanding cards from each other and drawing from the talon, setting any completed sets aside. Bonus points are given for scoring many sets from any of the three major regional divisions, and for drawing the Stockholm card.

There is no maximum number of players stated, but the deck size will support a deal to 14 players.

—user summary

Name: Wake Up Sheeple
Description:
Wake Up Sheeple is a conspiracy theorist's card game about finding the truth.  The game has players take the role of the General Public and the Mainstream Media. Each Mainstream Media player must use their own Subject and Motive cards to tell the General Public what actually happened during an Event drawn from the event deck.

This game is not simply a fill in the blank game.  We encourage players to craft their own insane truth to explain what happened and answer the question which the General Public has posed.

The General Public player will choose the winners for the rounds by picking the story they choose to believe.  They may choose the winner by whatever criteria they like.

The winning player will keep the Event card for scorekeeping. A Mainstream News Player is considered to have won the game by having a set amount of News Stories accepted into the mainstream -  that amount may be 3, 5, 10, or as many as players like.

Name: BITE
Description:
As the harvest approaches, the villagers gather and ponder the coming winter. Among them, darkness lurks, corrupting the town and its inhabitants. Unlikely allies will rise to either save this village or condemn it.

Can you make it through the lengthening nights and save the town? Or is something creeping up on you, disguised as a neighbor, waiting for its chance to BITE?

BITE is a social deduction game with secret roles for social gatherings. Players receive roles and pair up for a few minutes of conversation at a time, at the end of which each reveals an action card to the other player. They resolve these cards and move on to the next discussion, their motives changing throughout the game based upon which side they find themselves: Good or Evil. By the final night, either darkness will have been rooted out of the town, or it will have triumphed.

Each role has action cards associated with it that reveal information about their conversation partner, protect them from harm, convert them to their side, or kill them off in various ways. The roles are themed to a gothic fantasy setting including Witches, Hunters, Villagers, Occultists, Vampires and the like.

—description from the designer

Name: Poop tracks
Description:
Follow the tracks, don’t step in the scat, and spot that animal! Spin the spinner to draw cards, and complete the scene featuring each animal in their habitat, along with the correct tracks and poop! The first player to complete three scenes wins! Play this game a few times, and Jr. Ranger’s will become expert animal trackers. Don’t be afraid of the stinky.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kings of War: Clash of Kings – 2019 Edition
Description:
The world of Mantica trembles once again as armies march to war. This year’s annual organised play supplement includes all of the balance tweaks to continue to keep the game fun and competitive. There’s also new magic rules, stats for new epic monsters, rules for playing grand sieges, and stats for using the brand new units from Kings of War: Vanguard in you games of Kings of War!

—description from the publisher

Name: Counter Attack: Player Cards Set #1
Description:
Need more players for your Counter Attack set? Each set of player cards comes with 30 cards drawn from the Counter Attack universe. There are a total of 200 players to collect…

This is set #1. Players in this set include Gaham, Faye and Moriuchi.

Name: Counter Attack: Player Cards Set #2
Description:
Need more players for your Counter Attack set? Each set of player cards comes with 30 cards drawn from the Counter Attack universe. There are a total of 200 players to collect…

This is set #2. Players in this set include Chapman, Murphy and Hrstkova.

Name: Counter Attack: Player Cards Set #3
Description:
Need more players for your Counter Attack set? Each set of player cards comes with 30 cards drawn from the Counter Attack universe. There are a total of 200 players to collect…

This is set #3. Players in this set include Piskov, Budge and Lombardo.

Name: Counter Attack: Player Cards Set #4
Description:
Need more players for your Counter Attack set? Each set of player cards comes with 30 cards drawn from the Counter Attack universe. There are a total of 200 players to collect…

This is set #4. Players in this set include Thoma, Devine and Kuzmic.

Name: Counter Attack: Player Cards Set #5
Description:
Need more players for your Counter Attack set? Each set of player cards comes with 30 cards drawn from the Counter Attack universe. There are a total of 200 players to collect…

This is set #5. Players in this set include Gravis, Dillon and Kolodko.

Name: Pontiac's War: Frontier Rebellion, 1763-66
Description:
“I mean to destroy the English and leave not one upon our lands.”  Pontiac  “It is not in the Indian’s power to affect anything of consequence.” Major Gladwin.

Pontiac’s War 1763-1766 followed on the heels of the French and Indian War which ended in 1763. Thanks to Indian resentment over the French surrender of their lands and the harsh policies of General Jeffery Amherst, governor-general of British North America, 20+ Indian nations rose up under the charismatic leadership of the Ottawa sachem, Pontiac and the Lenape Holy Man, Neolin. Pontiac’s War attempts to recreate the reaction of Indian leaders to British mishandling of frontier politics and the impending colonial crisis it presaged. Building on the point-to-point system and loose Indian alliances used in King Philip's War, this design expands frontier conflict using Battle cards to introduce combat chaos, British expenditure on troops, Uncertain Indian Arms supply, siege rules, the capture of prisoners, French interference and trader influence.

The game offers five short introductory scenarios (15-30 minutes), three one-year campaign scenarios (2 hours), and one three-year grand campaign (5-6 hours). Although not a solitaire design, it is solitaire friendly. Components included a mounuted game map and large, 338 3/4" size punch-out counters.

Game Information:

Complexity: 4 out of 10
Solitaire Suitability: 5 out of 10
Time Scale: Seasonal turns (approx. 3 months per turn)
Map Scale: Point-to-Point map (approx. 60-75 miles between points)
Unit Scale: 30-50 men, 4-6 artillery guns, individual officers and sea vessels

—description from the publisher

Name: SEN: Save The Queen
Description:
In medieval times, twin princess rise in power to become queen. They split the land into west and east. Both queens hate each other and feel envious that the opposing land is greater than their land. Then one fateful day, these two queens rally their armies to wage war between themselves.

In SEN: Save The Queen, each player becomes the queen of their respective kingdom and duels to take the lands of the other. Using only eighteen tiles to play, each player must outwit the other to trap the opposing queen. Each player has three types of units: swordsmen, spearmen, and horsemen. The battlefield is a 3x3 grid of tiles, with each player's queen occupying an opposing corner and a priest as a neutral unit in the middle of the battlefield. Then each player in turn, places their units in the available spaces.

Gameplay is simple: There are eight action cards, and each player holds three cards at the beginning of the game. In turn order, each player can play a card from their side or take back two cards to their side of field. Each card affects certain units they control to move or attack opposing units. The player who can successfully occupy two adjacent grids owned by the enemy queen with their healthy units wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Colt Express: The Santa Claus Elf
Description:
This promo can be used with or without the expansions Horses & Stagecoach and Marshal & Prisoners. It contains:
1 Elf standee to be assembled and 8 tokens (4 Gift and 4 Empty).

Set up:

    Place the Elf standee in the third Wagon from the back of the train. Take as many tokens as there are Bandits, half Gift and half Empty. If there is an odd number of Bandits, take an Empty token of more than Gift Tokens. (Example: with 5 Bandits, take 2 Gift and 3 Empty).
    Shuffle the selected tokens face down and give one to each Bandit. These tokens must remain hidden from the opponents throughout the game. If you play with the Marshal & Prisoners expansion, do not give the marshal a token.


Rules:

    The Elf moves only following the bandits in motion.
    When a Bandit starts his movement triggered by an action Change Floor or Move from the position where the Elf is, move the Elf with the Bandit.
    The Elf can park on Marshal’s position.
    The Elf is not moved if the Bandit’s move is due to a Punch, an encounter with the Marshal, a Django shot or an end of round event.
    The Elf can not be targeted by a shot or a punch.
    If you play with the Horses & Stagecoach expansion, the Elf follows the Bandits in the Ride Action. He can enter and leave the stagecoach. He can park on the Shotgun’s position.
    If you play with the Marshal & Prisoners expansion, the Elf does not follow the Bandits in prison. He does not follow the Marshal either. If the Marshal does not win the game, the end-of-game rule below applies as with the basic game.


End of game:

    The Gunslinger prize is awarded then all Bandits reveal their Gift or Empty token.
    If the Elf is in the Locomotive or the Car adjacent to the Locomotive (inside or on the roof) at the end of the game, the winner is the richest Bandit among players with a Gift token. Players with an empty token are automatically eliminated.
    If the Elf is at least two cars away from the Locomotive, the winner is the richest Bandit among those with an Empty token. Players with a Gift token are automatically eliminated.

Name: Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North – Lawn Promo Card
Description:
Promo card for Empires of the North.

This card is a promo card made for and available from the Rolling Dice & Taking Names Gaming Podcast

To use this card, give it to the first player at the start of the game.

Card Text-
"Action: Spend 1 worker to gain 1 food and pass the card to the player on your left"

Name: Not It!
Description:
In Not It! you join the fun in a magical land as Knights, Princesses, Unicorns, Wizards, Dragons, and Ogres play together in the castle yard.

When the King rolls the 3 dice out of the castle door you must find a card in your hand that does not match any of the dice and then shout "Not it!" Spot the card that does NOT match, do it fast, and don't be last! If you get rid of all of your cards first you win!

—description from the publisher

Name: Habitation: Sucrerie
Description:
In 1680, on a small Caribbean island: Martinique
The rich settlers, the enriched buccaneers and even the religious orders lured by the hope of huge profits built many Habitations, these farms, true pre-industrial establishments technologically far ahead of their time, who not only exploited vast sugarcane fields but also slaves.

The game shows us to understand the economic complexity and the consequences of social injustices by testifing the daily life of such a Habitation, a strictly hierarchical microcosm, a dehumanized society where the thirst for freedom coexists with the thirst for profit

In Habitation sucrerie the players play a neutral role as observant but nonetheless active minds which can influence both  objectives of the Békés (Habitation masters) and the slaves, by an alternative asymmetrical game system mixing worker placement, aera control, hand management and exploration.


To win, players will have to control together the pawns of both sides and after 9 periods capitalize the most victory points in each of the two sides.

Name: Hooch Stooges
Description:
Welcome to Megacityopolis... the most hooch infested city during the roaring dandies. Become a boss and recruit your goons, then conquer your rival bosses and control Megacityopolis. Hooch Stooges' innovative mechanic asks you to risk your contraband before using it; allowing greater reward for the risk of being busted by the police.
—description from the back of the box

Hooch Stooges is a combination of Area Control and Deck-building. Turf cards are randomly distributed to make the playing area and each player begins play in their HQ. Cards are added to your deck by gaining Hooch and then used to attack and take over turf. Players are eliminated if their HQ turf is taken over by another player. The last player left on the board is the winner.
—user summmary

Name: New York Slice: Dipping Sauce
Description:
Dipping Sauce - Immediately eat up to two collected slices.

Given out during the 2019-2020 New York Slice convention tournament series.

Name: Champions of Midgard: Valhalla – Kes Bakyr
Description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

A new epic monster promo card for Champions of Midgard: Valhalla.

Name: Copenhagen: New Facades
Description:
The New Facades is the second Queenie for Copenhagen.

It provides new challenges and opportunities to play efficiently with multicolored tiles of size 5 or 6.

The size 6 tiles are added to the pool of tiles. The size 5 tiles replace the normal size 5 tiles in the base game.

If playing with both Queenies, five of the sized 5 multicolored tiles are randomly chosen each game to be used.

Name: Time of Legends: Joan of Arc – Sam the Blacksmith Promo Card
Description: Originally available for backers of The Dice Tower Kickstarter 2019.
Families: Game: Time of Legends – Joan of Arc

Name: Hostage Negotiator: The Mediator and The Mouth Dice Tower Promo Cards
Description:
This is a special set of promo cards originally offered to backers of the Dice Tower Kickstarter campaign.
Later available as part of the 2023 Game Boy Geek Season 11 Kickstarter.

—description from the publisher

Name: Stray Cats: Housing a Pet
Description:
This is an expansion pack for StrayCats. You would need the Stray Cats or Stray Dog deck to play this. The game will completely change. Without using any chosen house and Paw Law, the game is to collect animals inside houses. However, you must pair certain animals together to get higher victory points.

-description from designer

Name: Flamme Rouge: Dice Tower Stage Cards Promo Pack
Description:
Originally available as a reward from the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter Campaign.

Features 5 double sided cards with one side for 2-4 players, and the other 5-6 players.

Includes:

    Buonocore Boulevard
    Vasel Valley
    The Mandi Mile
    Suz Side Road
    Eric Avenue

Name: Stray Cats: Holiday Surprise
Description:
This is an expansion deck for StrayCats card game. To play this game, you will need to have the StrayCats/StrayDogs deck.

-Place the Holiday Surprise deck next to the StrayCat draw deck.
-Play the StrayCats game in the same old way.
-Gain a Holiday Suprise card every time you play a CAT CARD.
-Collect all the surprises for a bigger surprise.

-description from designer

Name: GoodCritters: Cheap Knockoffs Promo Cards
Description:
A set of 2 identical promo cards that were originally available as a reward from the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter.

Each card is worth -$1000

Name: Hanabi Deluxe: What a Show!
Description:
For the newest edition of Hanabi yet, expect a redesign, card stands, and three expansions included

• Avalanche of colors (10 multicolored cards)
• Black powder (10 black cards)
• 5 flamboyants (6 bonus tiles and a player sheet)

Hanabi—named for the Japanese word for "fireworks"—is a cooperative game in which players try to create the perfect fireworks show by placing the cards on the table in the right order. (In Japanese, hanabi is written as èŠ±ç«; these are the ideograms flower and fire, respectively.)

The card deck consists of five different colors of cards, numbered 1–5 in each color. For each color, the players try to place a row in the correct order from 1–5. Sounds easy, right? Well, not quite, as in this game you hold your cards so that they're visible only to other players. To assist other players in playing a card, you must give them hints regarding the numbers or the colors of their cards. Players must act as a team to avoid errors and to finish the fireworks display before they run out of cards.

An extra suit of cards, rainbow colored, is also provided for advanced or variant play.

Name: Lo sgranocchia colori di Pop
Description: It is a simple game for children based on association. Every player has to find cards of dinosaurs and coloured food of same colors. When it happens it is possible to take a coloured piece of dinosaurs to build it. First player who have a complete coloured dinosaur will win.

Name: Il gioco dell'oca di Cornabicorna
Description:
It is a game based on a goose game. You must roll the dice to advance on the board. In addition to the classic boxes in this case we have the boxes ivy. Whoever happens to us must draw a card in which there are challenges to be faced.
First will arrive on last box will win.

Name: Acchiappa la polpetta
Description: It is a dexterity game for very little children's. Some balls are placed in a bowl and then suddenly they come out. Each player has a dog-shaped glass and has to collect meatballs. At the start of the round, a draw done between different cards to decide the rule. you can get more meatballs, collect meatball sets or bet on in certain colors.

Name: Rise of an Emperor: Worlds in Conflict
Description:
After a war that almost destroyed the Earth, seven powerful factions, the so-called Regent Houses, now control the Earth and share their rule according to what is known as the Treaty. It is an almost perfect balance of power, since no House has enough strength to claim the throne they share by itself ... Until now.

One of the Regent Houses, the Envers House, has discovered how to travel to the distant worlds of the universe. And with those new worlds at their disposal to dominate and gain Power, all Houses seek to grow enough to claim the title of Earth Emperor.

In Rise of an Emperor: Worlds in Conflict, each player chooses one of the seven Regent Houses (each has 10 personalized cards) and two of the different paths that exist in the world of RoaE to gain power. Each of them (Science, Religion, Economy, Politics, Subterfuge, Military and Exploration) adds 20 more cards to build its initial deck. In addition, each House has three Counselors that can be used on the Council Board.

Players use cards for actions like increasing their House skills, raising their military and technological levels, building buildings, playing the characters of their House ...

The large number of cards in the game (770) allows a great variety of actions. You can make and break alliances with other races and civilizations, send assassins against your rivals, or spy on them to know what they hide. You can try to make your ruler a living God or be the richest House in the Universe. You can find alien artifacts, other races and friendly or hostile civilizations, worlds and moons, powerful strategic resources, build buildings such as the Academy of War or the Intelligence Center and an endless number of other options ...

Each House has a personal board to develop their civilization, and to do so many of the cards must be built before they can be used ... but both space and resources are limited.

In addition, there is the ubiquitous Treaty, which limits the Houses' actions. Many of the actions in the game are illegal ones. So in order to avoid the punishment we must cover them up or legalize them ... or maybe another House can catch us in fraganti !!!

Rise of an Emperor is a Civilizations 4x game, which uses mechanics like worker placement, hand and resource management, and hidden information management. Each game is different and the multiple combinations of customization make it highly replayable.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sub Terra: Incubation
Description:
Sub Terra Incubation is the fourth modular expansion for Sub Terra, introducing a new character, the Scavenger, as well as a brand new horrible thing to deal with, horror spawn. Faster but weaker than their fully grown cousins, these disgusting little blighters hatch from sticky, amniotic eggs that grow in the corners of the eery caves in Sub Terra.

Interact with them at your peril...

New tiles, new horrors, a new character. Incubation adds another chapter to your Sub Terra adventures!

—description from the publisher

Name: Conversion
Description:
Conversion is a social deduction board game with changing secret identities for 4 to 12 players. Explore an ancient castle filled with runes, crystal balls and secret passageways, while you attempt to locate the crypt and destroy the Great Demon. Each turn players execute one action simultaneously while working towards a long term goal. Players record their findings in a dry erase notebook, gradually constructing a web of game-relevant information. During encounters on the board, players may attempt to convert each other to good or evil using the games web server, a system designed to enhance the mystery and truly bring the game to life.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wingspan: European Expansion
Description:
In this first expansion to Wingspan, we increase the scope of the world to include the regal, beautiful, and varied birds of Europe. These birds feature a variety of new abilities, including a number of birds with round end abilities, abilities that increase interaction between players, and birds that benefit from excess cards/food. Along with the new bonus cards, they’re designed to be shuffled into the original decks of cards (and cards from future expansions).

The European Expansion also includes an additional tray for storing the growing collection of birds (past, present, and future), as well as 15 purple eggs, extra food tokens, and a colorful new scorepad designed for both multi-player and single-player scoring. It's designed by Elizabeth Hargrave and features birds illustrated by Natalia Rojas and Ana Maria Martinez.

—description from the publisher
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

Name: World War Africa: The Congo 1998-2001
Description:
World War Africa: The Congo 1998-2001 is a wargame simulation of the 2nd war fought over the Congo by two coalitions of African countries during the late 20th and early 21st centuries. The consequences of these two wars are still felt today.

In the war of 1996-97, the corrupt regime of Joseph Mobutu was overthrown by a coalition of East African countries led by Rwanda. The country formerly known as Zaire was renamed Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), and Mobutu was replaced by another Cold War era dinosaur, Laurent Kabila, at the helm of the huge, mineral-rich African country. One year later, however, Kabila’s sponsors, particularly Rwanda were not pleased. A number of issues including; the expulsion of Rwandan advisers from the DRC, Kabila recruiting Hutu combatants who had fled Rwanda, and the discrimination suffered by ethnic Tutsi in eastern DRC, moved Rwanda to try to remove Kabila from power. Supported by Uganda, Congolese rebels and the Tutsi minority in DRC, the Rwandans expected to win an easy victory, just as the year before. Kabila, however, was quickly supported by expeditionary forces of Zimbabwe and Angola, among other African countries, so overthrowing him turned out much harder than expected. The resulting conflict would involve about a dozen African countries, and cost the lives of an estimated 5 million people, thus earning the name of “World War Africa”, or “The Great African War”.

Each hex on the map represents 100 kilometers from side to side. Each turn of play represents from one to three months, with 13 game turns (GT) covering the period from August 1998 to June 2001. Ground units represent brigade, regiment and battalion sized formations. The combat aircraft units represent various numbers of sorties needed to accomplish missions over the time-frame of a turn.

—description from the designer


Published with Modern War #52
Families: Country: Democratic Republic of the Congo

Name: Muse: Game Boy Geek Season 7 Kickstarter Promo Card
Description:
Available from the Game Boy Geek Season 7 2019 Kickstarter.

New card to mix in with the base game.

Name: Lovelace & Babbage: Game Boy Geek Season 7 Patron Card
Description:
Available from the Game Boy Geek Season 7 Kickstarter campaign.

An additional patron card for the game.

Name: City of Gears: Music Shop Promo Tile
Description:
Available in the Game Boy Geek Season 7 Kickstarter campaign.

A new city tile to use in the game. Tile text: "Bring up to 2 Workers from adjacent tiles into this one. They may belong to any player and cross over any player's Gear Link."

Name: Football Highlights 2052: King Flutie Promo Card
Description:
Available in the Game Boy Geek Season 7 Kickstarter campaign.

A new player card for the game. Ability text is "Caught Off Guard: No Def Off Gains Play Yardage"

Name: Drop It: Scoring Variant Promo Cards
Description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes 5 cards - 4 rule cards + 1 overview card.

At the end of standard set up, shuffle the 4 cards. Reveal 2 of them and place them face up next to the scoreboard. Then read the cards out loud to everyone. These two rules apply in addition to the regular rules during this game (card rules supersede manual rules).

Name: Fields of Green: Dice Tower
Description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes a set of 3 identical cards.

Dice Tower - costs $4 (Building-Game End)
Roll a d6. Gain victory points equal to the result.

Name: Alien Artifacts: Alien System Cards
Description:
Originally available as part of the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes 5 new alien system cards.

Name: ICECOOL: Artifacts
Description:
Originally available as part of Promo Pack C from Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter Campaign.

Includes 4 cards.

At the beginning of every round, the catcher is the first to pick one of the artifacts to use this round. Then everybody else, going clockwise from the catcher, picks one. If playing with four, the last player does not have a choice and takes the last artifact.

Each artifact is usable once a round. When you take it, place it with the active (glowing) side up. Once it has been used, flip it to its inactive side (not glowing).

Ancient clock - Lets a player reset the turn he just made, by placing all the pieces in the positions and places they were before he made the flick. Then take the turn (flick) again.

Trap - At the beginning of the round (when the player chooses this artifact) player places the trap anywhere on the board, when any other player touches the card (slides on or over it), the card is removed and becomes inactive. The player who placed the trap flicks the other players penguin in any direction he wants.

Teleport - At the beginning of the round (when the player chooses this artifact) player places the teleport anywhere on the board. At the start or end of that player’s turn that player can place their penguin on that card. After you move away from the card (by taking a flick or being bumped off) it is removed from the board and becomes inactive.

Platform - At the end of this player’s turn he may place the card on top of a spot where boxes make a T(connection point of three boxes) and one of these boxes must be the one where players penguin is. This card becomes a platform onto which the player places their penguin on. Player starts his next turn from the platform then the card is removed and becomes inactive.
â€‹

Name: Vanamehe mäng
Description:
Game is inspired by "Vanamehe multikas" animated shorts and the feature film. Vanamees ("Old man") is a local hero loved by people, who always gets involved into humorous and absurd adventures with both his grandchildren and local villagers alike. He is wise and good-looking just like you. The same goes about his relatives, rivals, acquaintances and other animals. Time, milk and other stuff will fly convivially when playing together!

GOAL OF THE GAME is to collect as many task cards as possible.

GAME-PLAY

     Lead player spins the bottle. The one the bottle appoints is the new lead player. 
     Lead player takes a topmost task card and reads the task of same color than the colored die in the bottle. In case the die shows white, lead player can pick the color without reading the task first.
     According to the task card, someone: gets the card and places it in front of them face down;  gets assignment and places it in front of them face up; looses a card and gives it to another player.
     Game ends when the draw pile is emptied. Player with the most cards in front of them wins the game.

Name: Treasure Island: The Pirates Mark
Description:
The pirates got their hands on Silver’s secret map, on which appears the famous « pirates mark », engraved with the invisible ink.

In this expansion Long John Silver draws his secret sign on the game board with a dry erase UV-marker. The players looking for the treasure can, in their turn, use a special UV-lamp to search for the sign in order to have extra information on where the secret may be hidden.

Contents:
1 chiffon Jolly Roger
4 markers for the pirates
1 invisible pen with a UV lamp for Silver
1 pirates mark tile

Name: Camp Pinetop: Nature Expansion
Description:
The Nature Expansion adds another layer to game play. During set up players will pick one of four animals: Otter, Trout, Elk or Beaver. One of these animals will start on a random space. Next, the Bear and eagle will be placed on a random space as well. Players will also place a weather icon above a random column.

Adding in different animals and weather elements will increase the depth of the game. Animals have special powers that can help or hinder your ability to complete achievements in the game. While you can not play with all the animals at the same time, you will choose a set of animals for each game when you play this is delightful expansion. Animals and weather will move through the wilderness throughout the game. This will give a more realistic feeling of camping out and completing your achievement patches!

Name: Wissen & Quizzen: Retter und Helfer
Description:
In this card game 3 assistants "Käpt'n Quizzo" (KQ), "Reno Retter" (RR) and "Helli Helfer" (HH) guide through one of 3 different game modes.

Knowledge: Learn about rescue systems specified on 26 different cards with RR.

Trivia game: All players answer KQs questions and score victory points. KQ announces the winner at the end of the game.

Card Game with HH

For all games the Tiptoi pen is required.
The Cards can be combined with any of other Game of Wissen & Quizzen Series for more variety of trivia themes.

Name: Wissen & Quizzen: Die Welt der Saurier
Description:
In this card game 3 assistants "Käpt'n Quizzo" (KQ), "Sami Saurus" (SS) and "Mats Mogel" (MM) guide through one of 3 different game modes.


     Knowledge: Learn about the dinosaurs specified on 26 different cards with SS.
     Trivia game: All players answer KQs questions and score victory points. KQ announces the winner at the end of the game.
     Card Game with MM


For all games the Tiptoi pen is required.
The Cards can be combined with any of other Game of Wissen & Quizzen Series for more variety of trivia themes.

Name: Dominant Reign: Earth Expanse Edition
Description:
Dominant Reign brings forth the future where Earth has finally united to face the universe together.  As they attain faster than light travel they encounter the Star Elders, a powerful alien race that seeks to keep the peace between the universe's inhabitants from infringing on each others borders. The real threat, the Blight, continues to grow and the universe must face them together.

This non-collectible stand-alone pick-up game is based in a sci-fi universe with four factions; the Earth Expanse, the Star Elders, the Neutral Zone, and the Blight.  Select your allegiance at the beginning of the game, stage the playing field, change your loyalties, and bluff your way to victory.

Claim your faction, dominate the universe!

—description from the publisher

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Followers of Bone
Description:
Many in Westeros regard those in the Free Folk army as savages, and many in the Free Folk seem to go out of their way to enhance that feeling. The Followers of Bone are devoted to the Lord of Bones and have bedecked themselves with an assortment of macabre skeletal accessories, including using them as weapons in battle. Their disquieting practices and appearance has a marked effect on the enemy.

The Followers of Bone unit box gives Free Folk commanders a scary new unit to fill their ranks. The horrific visages of these warriors can cause enemies to shrink back instead of surging forward, making them take a Panic Test before they can attack the Followers. Add to that the Champion of Bone Unit Attachment that grants restored Wounds to the unit whenever an enemy fails a Panic Test when engaged with them, and the Followers can be a very durable unit, indeed.

Contents:
13 Miniatures
  â€£ 12 Followers of Bone
  â€£ 1 Champion of Bone
1 Unit Card
1 Attachemnt Card
1 Movement Tray

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Simon Optix
Description:
The Simon Optix game takes the Simon game to exciting heights.

Put on the headset and get ready to watch, remember, repeat!

The innovative Simon Optix game is a wearable electronic game of lights and sounds in which players must repeat random sequences of lights by moving their hands in the correct order. 
The suspense builds as the sequence gets longer! 
Play solo or with friends in Sync Mode (requires additional headsets, which are sold separately and are subject to availability). 
No matter which mode they play, kids can challenge themselves to beat their high score!

—description from the publisher

Name: 18NC
Description:
18NC is an 18xx game about operating and investing in the historic railroad companies of North Carolina beginning in 1835 with the Wilmington and Raleigh Railroad being chartered (later to become Wilmington and Weldon).

Three to five players represent investors in these railroad companies attempting to increase their own net worth while avoiding the costly liabilities of a failing railroad. Careful manipulation of the State’s share ownership can be advantageous to avoid personal liability.

Name: Darbak Khadar
Description:
Darbak Khadar is a race to reach the final green square on the canvas. It can be played as individuals or as competing teams of two.

You toss the colored ball, and the color you get determnes the square you need to move to. If you get a green color you move to the next green box on the canvas and play again. If you land on an elevator squares you toss the ball again to figure out whether you go down, up or forward depending on the color you get.

Name: King's Keys deck
Description:
The King’s Keys deck takes a new look at playing cards. While standard decks are 4x13 (4 suits and 13 ranks), the King’s Keys deck uses a 4x4x4 logic. Each card in the 64 card deck has a Number (1, 2, 3, or 4), an Item (Key, Axe, Shield or Coin) and a Kingdom Color (Yellow Sun, Red Mountains, Green Forest or Blue Ocean).
The deck plays a variety of games for players at all skill levels. Some rules are included with the deck but most are on the website. Players are also encouraged to try inventing new games of their own.

Name: In the Hall of the Mountain King: Tantrum House Promo Cards
Description:
This pair of level 2 troll cards was produced for the Tantrum House podcast season 6 Kickstarter campaign.

The first card is a Fire Clan troll that produces 1 hammer, 1 coin, and 1 fire cart. The second card is an Ice Clan troll that produces 1 iron, 1 wild cart, and 1 ice cart.

Name: The Ancient World (Second Edition): Dice Tower 2019 Promo Cards
Description:
A set of 3 cards packaged together that were originally available during the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes:
Forest Waterfall – You may pay 2 ambrosia to gain 1 knowledge.
Forest River – Pay 1 ambrosia instead of 3 coins for districts.
Forest Gate – You may pay armies with ambrosia.

Name: Blasting Boxes
Description:
A simple style euro game suitable for kids and families. Each player needs to get as many points as possible.

In the game, players assume the roles of warehouse workers, each of them needing to stack his/her shelf with as many boxes as possible without letting the boxes break. Whoever gets the most points becomes the new store manager.

There are some rules, bonus points, and special combo cards that allow you to tackle your opponents or increase your own score.
